About Me!

A few fun facts to help you get to know me better.

Laila Denman

Software Engineer

I like to roller skate, watch anime, and read webcomics in my free time. I also love hanging out with friends and listening to music. My favorite pass time is playing card games or board games or puzzles/mind games I think it's fun that I have to figure out a strategy or a solution. A majority of the time of time you'll see me playing "Magic: The Gathering" or editing a deck for it because I love that there are so many different ways that game can be played and customized.

My Journey

Here is a walkthrough of my career so far.

  • 2019-2020

    College of the Canyons

    I studied computer science at college of the canyons. I took classes such as Algorithms and Progamming as well as Data Structures. I also learned JavaScript here as I had previously been using Java throughout high school.

  • July 2020 - Present

    Receptionist

    I started working as a receptionist at a veterinary hospital. Here I learned customer service and client communication to keep our clients happy and informed. I also learned prioritization to help decrease wait times for our clients.

  • November 2021 - Present

    IT Manager

    The veterinary hospital I worked at decided to go completely digital and placed me in charge of setting everything up. This meant implementing new software, creating applications to aide them wherever the new software was lacking, maintaining devices, fixing any technical issues that may occur.

  • July 2022 - July 2023

    App Academy

    After researching for a while I found App Academy where I was able to learn everything I needed to learn in order to become a great software engineer. With them I was able to practice and create frontend, backend, and fullstack projects as well as practice with database communication.

  • Be Part
    Of My
    Story!

CoverMe

An app made for employees to be able to cover and request coverage for a shift and easily communicate with other coworkers.

This application features an algorithm I developed to arrange each day in each month correctly using conditionals without any pre-existing packages or components to display an accurate calendar for the user to create and view calendar events in which they can request coverage or accept a shift. It also has group and individual messaging between users within a group using integrated websockets and auth routes to allow users to send messages in real time while restricting access to messages outside of their group to ensure privacy of messages to those in each group. I created a custom API so that users can search for and request to join groups as well as use the basic CRUD abilities on each group. The group owners have the ability to accept or deny requests usig the API as well.

  • Skills: Python, Flask, Websockets, React, Redux, Javascript, SqlAlchemy
  • Live Site
  • GitHub

Farm-To_Table

A commerce web app where users can order different produce straight from the farmers.

With my team I was able to help create an online shopping site where users can manage CRUD operations for their carts using custom SQL queries and Sqlalchemy. After applying auth routes I was able to confine the users access to only their carts to ensure that no other users can view its contents. I used more custom SQL Queries to grab a filtered set of data for all the users to view the products by category as well.

  • Skills: Python, Flask, React, Redux, Javascript, SQL
  • Live Site
  • GitHub

Airbnb Clone

Airbnb clone where users can book places to stay and offer their own places to rent out.

In this application I used SQL to organize the data in order to allow users to manage scheduling and booking CRUD operations. I then implemented auth routes to limit a users access to certain booking features to give security to the users information.

  • Skills: Javascript, ReactJS, Express, SQL
  • Live Site
  • GitHub
